item.title: Report X-2024051139
item.description:
Report X-2024051139

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS CALLED TO THE CLERK'S AREA FOR SOME BROKEN GLASS. RESPONDER IMMEDIATELY WENT TO THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE A HAZMAT. FROM THERE A 15FT HOTZONE WAS CREATED, ALL APPROPRIATE PPE WAS WORN AND THE SPILL CART WAS FULL PRIOR TO ARRIVAL. THE DECISION TREE WAS FOLLOWED

item.title: Report X-2024051329
item.description:
Report X-2024051329

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-18
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 700
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The tank car was reported leaking by UPRR yard personnel. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. The tank car was found to have the B end liquid valve open with the plug less than tool tight. The valve was closed, and the plug tightened properly. The car was resealed and did not require an OTMA per FRA inspector Danny Wood.

item.title: Report X-2024051044
item.description:
Report X-2024051044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: DFW AIRPORT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY EIGHT POUNDS OF BROOKSHIRE'S DRY ICE COOLING STEAKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS NOT FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT.
